page.title: 15Fund-raising in Gayton
page.content: Fund raising seems to be an endless task in the village and 1985 has seen a major effort to raise enough money to modernise the village hall. The hall needed a new floor, heating system, kitchen, store room, new toilets and complete redecoration both inside and out. Fund-raising events included a Sponsored Fun Run, a Village Tote, an "Auction of Anything", the publishing of a local magazine called Gayton News and many other well supported events. The Gayton News made 345 pounds and the Flower Festival, 1,260 pounds. These, along with generous donations from many people plus a grant from the Northampton County Council enabled modernisation work to be carried out on the hall. It was re-opened on May 10th 1985.
